title: Sock toe closing system for circular knitting machines
abstract: We have 20+ yearsâ€™ experience working with precision mechanics for several industries. We have a number of own developments and products including patents for knitting machines. Based on our experience with knitting machines we have developed (and patented) the ClosedToe technology and have installed it on 50 circular knitting machines. Our ClosedToe solution allows the retrofitting of circular knitting machines with a device which folds the toe part of the sock together so it can be sewn together with the same machine. As a result, existing machines can be converted easily to become an all-in-one machine eliminating the need for a linking machine and manual labour. At present we have developed the ClosedToe solution for one brand to be used in two of their machines, but to reach commercial success we need to adapt it to the most common brands and types of circular knitting machines used by the industry. The aim of the ClosedToe Phase 1 project is to carry out an extensive market research and identify the most commonly used knitting machines by the industry and conclude a market entry and commercialisation strategy. During the Phase 2 development we will develop the ClosedToe solution for the identified machine types and enter the market according to the predefined strategy. The potential impact of this development is huge in the long term, but even in the short term we see that the ClosedToe technology will generate a significant profit 3 years after the development is completed. We have wide range of networks (over 50 past customers) and based on feedback from our flagship partners there is a significant need for our innovation. This gives us the perfect platform to commercialise our new technology.

motivations: Circular knitting machines require additional manual labor and a linking machine to close the toe part of socks, reducing efficiency and increasing costs.
There is a need for an adaptable and automated solution to retrofit existing circular knitting machines for improved productivity.
objectives: Conduct market research to identify the most commonly used circular knitting machines in the industry.
Develop and adapt the ClosedToe solution for the identified machine types to enable automated sock toe closing.
Commercialize the ClosedToe technology and enter the market with a predefined strategy.
methods: Carry out extensive market research to identify target machine types and develop a market entry strategy.
Develop and adapt the patented ClosedToe technology for the identified circular knitting machines.
Utilize existing networks and partnerships to commercialize the innovation.
results: Eliminate the need for manual labor and linking machines in sock production, increasing efficiency and reducing costs.
Generate significant profits within three years of completing the development of the ClosedToe technology.
Improve productivity and competitiveness in the knitting industry through the adoption of the ClosedToe solution.
llama_json.research_subject: Automated sock toe closing system for circular knitting machines

motivations: The current process of sock toe closing in circular knitting machines requires additional machines and manual labour, which is inefficient and costly.
There is a need to adapt the ClosedToe technology to different brands and types of circular knitting machines to achieve commercial success.
objectives: Develop and patent the ClosedToe technology that allows retrofitting of circular knitting machines to sew the toe part of the sock, eliminating the need for additional machines and manual labour.
Identify the most commonly used knitting machines in the industry and adapt the ClosedToe technology to these machines.
Develop a market entry and commercialisation strategy for the ClosedToe technology.
methods: Use extensive market research to identify the most commonly used knitting machines in the industry.
Adapt the ClosedToe technology to the identified machine types during the Phase 2 development.
Enter the market according to the predefined strategy.
results: Existing knitting machines can be easily converted into all-in-one machines, eliminating the need for a linking machine and manual labour.
The ClosedToe technology is expected to generate significant profit 3 years after the development is completed.
The development has the potential to have a huge impact in the long term.

motivations: Circular knitting machines require separate linking machines and manual labor to close sock toes, creating inefficiencies in the production process.
The sock manufacturing industry needs cost-effective retrofitting solutions to convert existing machines into all-in-one systems.
objectives: Adapt the ClosedToe technology to the most commonly used brands and types of circular knitting machines in the industry.
Develop a comprehensive market entry and commercialization strategy for the ClosedToe solution.
methods: Conduct extensive market research to identify the most commonly used knitting machine types in the industry.
Develop and adapt the patented ClosedToe retrofitting device for multiple machine brands and models.
results: Enable existing circular knitting machines to become all-in-one systems that eliminate the need for separate linking machines and manual labor.
Generate significant profit and market penetration within three years of development completion.
